messages.message:
Hi team,

I am currently looking at a figma mock (https://www.figma.com/design/npoWdg4HRTwqn6J0zrCybD/EPD-2902-EPD-3491---Data-types?node-id=2669-53764&t=fdtgm0xbtI1dJIvC-0) that is using `brackets` as an icon. As far as I can tell, based on our pollen `Icon` component we don't have this icon in our design library. Is there an easy way to add one?
Not too sure how it works here, but usually in my past I would export the icon myself -> minimize the file https://vecta.io/nano -> then add icon to library/use it directly~

^ Along the same line: You can export as SVG for that icon from Figma. From there, create a PR on `pollen` to add a new icon.

Here's an example PR:
https://github.com/instabase/pollen/pull/1291
(you may have to modify the SVG attributes to remove some hard coded width/height
Nice! First contribution to pollen coming up :blossom: . Thank you!
